description.plain:
Pitbull (born January 15, 1981) is a Cuban-American MC, born and raised in Miami, Florida. Nowadays he’s left his MC abilities and centered his career in the Pop and mainstream industry.

In 2001, Pitbull aka Mr.305 signed to Uncle Luke’s Records. There he started his career as MC, throwing out a series of mixtapes under the name of Unleashed. Through Uncle Luke Pitbull came to know people in the movement like Lil'Jon or The Diaz Brothers.

In 2004, Pitbull releases his debut LP, M.I.A.M.I. Acronym of Money Is A Major Issue with the lead single Culo, produced by Lil'Jon and the Diaz Brothers. Culo became a club banger, but the Jamaican artist Mr. Vegas accused Pitbull of copying his “Push Up”. This led to a beef to which Pîtbull responded with “Mr. Vegas Diss”.



Discography

2002: Unleashed Vol.1
2003: Unleashed Vol.2
2004: Unleashed Vol.3
2004: M.I.A.M.I.
2004: Unleashed Vol.4
2005: Welcome To The 305
2005: Unleashed Vol.5
2006: M.I. (still) A.M.I.
2006: El Mariel
2006: Unleashed Vol.6
2007: The Boatlift
2008:Free Agent
2009: Shittin On The Industry
2009: Rebelution
2010: Armando
2011: Planet Pit
2012: Global Warming
2013: Meltdown
2014: Globalization
2015: Dale
2017: Climate Change
2017: Greatest Hits
2019: Libertad 548

songs.title: Feel This Moment

description.plain:
“Feel This Moment” is a song by American rapper Pitbull, featuring guest vocals from Christina Aguilera. The song was released as the fourth single from Pitbull’s album Global Warming, and marks the first collaboration between the two.

Lyrically, the song is about living life to the fullest and enjoying each and every moment.

songs.full_title: Timber by Pitbull (Ft. Kesha)
songs.title: Timber

description.plain:
http://youtu.be/hHUbLv4ThOo

“Timber” is a song by American rapper Pitbull, featuring recording artist Kesha. The song was released on October 7, 2013 as the lead single from Pitbull’s EP, Meltdown. The song was produced by Dr. Luke, Cirkut, and Sermstyle, with additional production by Nick Seeley. The song interpolates the song “San Francisco Bay”, written by Lee Oskar, Keri Oskar, and Greg Errico.

The song features harmonica player Paul Harrington of Rockwall, Texas who plays through the entire song. He was told to emulate War harmonica player Lee Oskar.

In an interview in December 2013, Pitbull revealed that the featured artist on “Timber” was originally supposed to be Rihanna. At the time, however, he stated that Rihanna was already asked to be the featured artist on the lead single off Shakira’s upcoming album and didn’t have time to record “Timber”. Pitbull later asked Ke$ha to be the featured artist and she accepted.

description.plain:
“Give Me Everything” is Pitbull’s first single to hit #1 on the Billboard Hot 100, and is arguably his most successful one.

In this song, Pitbull, along with Ne-Yo, Nayer, and Afrojack, ask their lover to not hold back and “give” them “everything tonight”.

songs.title: We Are One (Ole Ola)
songs.title_with_featured: We Are One (Ole Ola) (Ft. Claudia Leitte & Jennifer Lopez)

description.plain:
Released on April 8th, 2014, this is the theme song to the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

The video was released on May 16th, 2014. It was shot during February 2014 in Fort Lauderdale, Florida, United States.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TGtWWb9emYI

Pitbull, Jennifer Lopez and Cláudia  Leitte performed “We Are One (Ole Ola)” live at the 2014 FIFA World Cup opening ceremony on June 12, 2014 in Arena Corinthians, São Paulo.

The trio also performed the song at the 2014 Billboard Music Awards on May 19th, 2014.

songs.full_title: Fireball by Pitbull (Ft. John Ryan)
songs.title: Fireball

description.plain:
“Fireball” is the lead single from Pitbull’s album Globalization. It was released to the public on July 23, 2014, and the hook is sung by American pop singer John Ryan.

Pitbull stated in an interview that the song’s name comes from how he sees a very beautiful woman and a sexy man as a fireball. However, it can also be interpretated as a representation of his fame and fortune.

description.plain:
Culo is the lead single from Pitbull’s  debut album M.I.A.M.I.and features Lil Jon. The song peaked at number 11 on the US Hot Rap Tracks(Billboard). The word Culo means ‘ass’ in Spanish and Italian.

The song is sampled from Nina Sky’s hit “Move Ya Body”.

description.plain: “Hey Baby (Drop It to the Floor)” is a song by American rapper Pitbull featuring T-Pain.[1] It was released on September 14, 2010 as the lead single from Pitbull’s sixth studio album Planet Pit.[2] The song was written by Pitbull, T-Pain, and Sandy Vee, and it was produced by Sandy Vee.

songs.full_title: Don't Stop the Party by Pitbull (Ft. TJR)
songs.title: Don’t Stop the Party

description.plain: “Don’t Stop the Party” is a song recorded by American rapper Pitbull for his seventh studio album, Global Warming. The song features TJR and includes samples of the song “Funky Kingston” by Toots and the Maytals replayed by Mark Summers at Scorccio Sample Replays. It was released on September 25, 2012 as the album’s third single by RCA Records.

songs.full_title: Back in Time by Pitbull
songs.title: Back in Time

description.plain:
Released in 2012, “Back in Time” is the tie-in theme song of the film “Men in Black 3.” The previous two movies in the franchise also had rapped theme songs, those by the movies' star Will Smith. Smith, who hadn’t rapped since 2005, was replaced by a more bankable rapper, Pitbull.

The song samples Mickey and Sylvia’s “Love Is Strange,” a rhythm and blues song from 1956. The entire chorus of the original is transplanted here.

songs.full_title: Ocean To Ocean by Pitbull (Ft. Rhea)
songs.title: Ocean To Ocean

description.plain:
“Ocean To Ocean” is a song by Pitbull and special guest Rhea, which samples “Africa” by Toto. The track acts as the promotional single for the soundtrack of the DC film, Aquaman, released on December 14, 2018.

Small Spoiler for Aquaman under the cut

A song about triumph and overwhelming success, “Ocean to Ocean” appears to mostly be about Pitbull – however, its first intro and first verse could easily be applied to the protagonist and titular character of Aquaman himself, Arthur Curry.

While also the movie’s promotional single, the song also makes its appearance in the film itself, when Arthur and Mera arrive at the Sahara Desert to look for clues regarding an ancient artifact (hence the use of Toto’s “Africa”).

songs.full_title: Welcome To Dade County (Lil Wayne Diss) by Pitbull
songs.title: Welcome To Dade County (Lil Wayne Diss)
songs.title_with_featured: Welcome To Dade County (Lil Wayne Diss)

description.plain:
A week after Lil Wayne’s Miami Heat outburst, Pitbull has risen to arms to defend his home state in general. Tapping into the recent ‘Harlem Shake’ phenomenon, he’s delivered a diss track over the electronic dance hit. Although tame in comparison to your average rap attack, Tunechi does get a good scolding.

After shouting out Lebron James, Dwyane Wade and Udonis Haslem, “Mr. Worldwide” reps Dade County specifically, and claims the New Orleans rapper broke the “rules and codes” of those streets with his verbal attack on the Heat. While talking up himself and his county, he warns him not to do so again:

“Here’s a deposition: watch what you speak / Who’s the definition of Miami? Me.”

“You talk Miami, if you talkin’ heat / Moral of the story: don’t shit where you eat.”

During the track’s outro, Pitbull claims a deep love and loyalty for the city, and expresses shock that Wayne could attack Miami this way after all the love Florida showed New Orleans during the aftermath of Hurricane Katrina.

Will Wayne respond?

songs.full_title: Wild Wild Love by Pitbull (Ft. G.R.L.)
songs.title: Wild Wild Love

description.plain:
The lead single from Pitbull’s eighth studio album Globalization, featuring girl group G.R.L. It was released on February 25, 2014.

The song is a mix of pop, rap, EDM and folk. It peaked at number 30 on the Billboard Hot 100, and was recently used in a trailer for The Secret Life of Pets.
